title: Enhance E0463 "can't find crate" error message by hints indicating the starting point of a path to a solution.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: [Playground Link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=789e6c67bf0e73b4b49b82e6e91a5b96)

```rust
#![feature(plugin, core)]
#![plugin(phf_macros)]

fn main() {
    println!("hello world");
}
```

The current output is (for stable and nightly):

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `phf_macros`
 --> src/main.rs:2:11
  |
2 | #![plugin(phf_macros)]
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^ can't find crate

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `phf_macros`
 --> src/main.rs:2:11
  |
2 | #![plugin(phf_macros)]
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^ can't find crate

Hints:
    - If using Cargo, double check your entry in `[dependencies]` section in Cargo.toml.
    - Check if the crate you want to use is present at crates.io.
    - When in a process of upgrading, double check the documentation of the crate you want to use.
      There may be a breaking change between the versions.

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

Maybe it would be nice to get something like a small checklist on how to address this issue? I filled the proposed output above with things that came to my mind (and by copying from `rustc --explain E0463`) while writing the issue.
